title: Accuracy
excerpt: A metric measuring how often a model's predictions are correct. Calculated as the ratio of correct predictions to total predictions.

title: Activation Function
excerpt: A mathematical function applied to neurons that introduces non-linearity, enabling neural networks to learn complex patterns.

title: Adversarial Attack
excerpt: Deliberate attempts to deceive AI systems by providing specially crafted inputs that cause incorrect predictions or harmful outputs.

title: AI Agent
excerpt: An AI system that can perceive its environment, make decisions, and take actions to achieve goals using tools and external systems.

title: AI (Artificial Intelligence)
excerpt: Computer systems designed to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as understanding language and making decisions.

title: AI Ethics
excerpt: The study of moral principles guiding AI development and use, covering fairness, transparency, privacy, and societal impact.

title: AI Readiness
excerpt: The skills, knowledge, and mindset needed to use AI tools effectively and responsibly.

title: Alignment
excerpt: Ensuring AI systems behave in ways that match human values and intentions. A key concern in AI safety research.

title: Algorithm
excerpt: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem. In AI, algorithms define how models learn from data and make predictions.

title: Annotation
excerpt: The process of labeling data to create training datasets for supervised learning.

title: Anthropic
excerpt: An AI safety company that created Claude, focused on developing safe and beneficial AI systems.

title: API
excerpt: Application Programming Interface - protocols allowing applications to communicate and integrate AI capabilities.

title: Attention Mechanism
excerpt: A technique allowing models to focus on relevant parts of input when producing output. Foundation of transformer architecture.

title: AutoGen
excerpt: Microsoft's framework for building multi-agent AI applications with collaborative AI agents.

title: Autoencoder
excerpt: A neural network that learns to compress data into smaller representations and reconstruct it.

title: Autoregressive Model
excerpt: A model generating output one element at a time, using previous outputs to predict the next. How LLMs generate text.

title: Backpropagation
excerpt: The fundamental algorithm for training neural networks by calculating and propagating error signals backward.

title: Batch
excerpt: A subset of training data processed together in one iteration, improving training efficiency.

title: Batch Size
excerpt: The number of training examples processed together before updating model weights.

title: Beam Search
excerpt: A search algorithm maintaining multiple candidate sequences during text generation.

title: Benchmark
excerpt: A standardized test used to evaluate and compare AI model performance.

title: BERT
excerpt: Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers - an influential language model processing text bidirectionally.

title: Bias
excerpt: Systematic errors or unfair preferences in AI outputs reflecting biases in training data or system design.

title: Black Box
excerpt: A system whose internal workings are not visible or understandable. Many AI models are considered black boxes.

title: BPE (Byte Pair Encoding)
excerpt: A tokenization algorithm breaking text into subword units by iteratively merging frequent character pairs.

title: Catastrophic Forgetting
excerpt: The tendency of neural networks to forget previously learned information when trained on new data.

title: Chain-of-Thought (CoT)
excerpt: A prompting technique encouraging AI to show its reasoning process step-by-step for more accurate responses.

title: Chat Completion
excerpt: An API endpoint where models generate conversational responses from a list of messages.

title: ChatGPT
excerpt: OpenAI's conversational AI product that popularized LLMs and sparked widespread public interest in AI.

title: Classification
excerpt: A machine learning task assigning input data to predefined categories like spam detection or sentiment analysis.

title: Claude
excerpt: An AI assistant by Anthropic, designed to be helpful, harmless, and honest with strong reasoning capabilities.

title: Clustering
excerpt: An unsupervised learning technique grouping similar data points together without predefined labels.

title: CNN (Convolutional Neural Network)
excerpt: A neural network architecture designed for processing images using convolutional layers.

title: Code Generation
excerpt: AI models that write programming code from natural language descriptions, powering tools like GitHub Copilot.

title: Cohere
excerpt: An enterprise AI company providing LLMs for text generation, embeddings, and search with strong RAG capabilities.

title: Computer Vision
excerpt: The AI field enabling machines to interpret visual information from images and videos.

title: Constitutional AI
excerpt: Anthropic's approach where models are trained to follow a set of principles guiding their behavior.

title: Context
excerpt: Background information provided to AI that helps it understand your situation and needs.

title: Context Window
excerpt: The amount of text (in tokens) an AI can process at once, ranging from 4K to 200K+ tokens.

title: Copilot
excerpt: Microsoft's AI assistant for code completion and general assistance across their products.

title: COSTAR
excerpt: A prompting framework: Context, Objective, Style, Tone, Audience, Response for professional content.

title: CRISP
excerpt: A prompting framework: Context, Role, Instructions, Specifics, Parameters for everyday AI tasks.

title: CRISPE
excerpt: CRISP extended with Examples for few-shot learning in creative tasks.

title: Cross-Attention
excerpt: Attention where queries come from one sequence and keys/values from another, used in multimodal systems.

title: Cursor
excerpt: An AI-powered code editor built on VS Code, designed for AI-first development.

title: DALL-E
excerpt: OpenAI's image generation model creating images from text descriptions.

title: Data Augmentation
excerpt: Techniques to expand training datasets by creating modified versions of existing data.

title: Dataset
excerpt: A collection of data used for training, validating, or testing AI models.

title: Decoder
excerpt: The neural network component that generates output from encoded representations.

title: Deep Learning
excerpt: A subset of machine learning using neural networks with many layers to learn complex patterns.

title: DeepMind
excerpt: Google's AI research lab known for AlphaGo, AlphaFold, and Gemini, pioneering reinforcement learning and scientific AI.

title: DeepSeek
excerpt: A Chinese AI company known for efficient, high-performing open models at lower computational costs.

title: Deepfake
excerpt: AI-generated synthetic media where a person's likeness is manipulated, raising misinformation concerns.

title: Delimiter
excerpt: Characters used in prompts to clearly separate different sections, like triple backticks or XML tags.

title: Diffusion Model
excerpt: A generative architecture creating content by gradually removing noise, powering leading image generators.

title: Dimensionality Reduction
excerpt: Techniques to reduce the number of features in data while preserving important information.

title: Knowledge Distillation
excerpt: Transferring knowledge from a large teacher model to a smaller student model.

title: DPO (Direct Preference Optimization)
excerpt: A simpler alternative to RLHF that directly optimizes models using preference data.

title: Dropout
excerpt: A regularization technique randomly deactivating neurons during training to prevent overfitting.

title: Embedding
excerpt: A dense vector representation of data where similar items have similar vectors.

title: Emergent Abilities
excerpt: Capabilities appearing in large AI models that weren't present in smaller versions.

title: Encoder
excerpt: A neural network component transforming input into compressed representations.

title: Endpoint
excerpt: A specific URL where an API can be accessed for different AI functions.

title: Epoch
excerpt: One complete pass through the entire training dataset during model training.

title: Evaluation
excerpt: Measuring model performance using metrics, benchmarks, and human assessment.

title: Explainability (XAI)
excerpt: The ability to understand and explain how AI models make decisions.

title: Information Extraction
excerpt: Using AI to identify and extract specific information from unstructured text.

title: F1 Score
excerpt: A metric combining precision and recall into a single score for classification evaluation.

title: Feature
excerpt: An individual measurable property of data used as input to a model.

title: Feedforward Neural Network
excerpt: A neural network where information flows in one direction from input to output.

title: Few-Shot Learning
excerpt: Providing examples in prompts to help AI understand desired patterns or formats.

title: Fine-Tuning
excerpt: Training a pre-existing model on specialized data to improve specific task performance.

title: Flipped Interaction
excerpt: A method where AI asks clarifying questions before providing advice.

title: Foundation Model
excerpt: A large AI model trained on broad data that can be adapted to many downstream tasks.

title: Function Calling
excerpt: LLM capability to generate structured output for calling external functions or APIs.

title: GAN (Generative Adversarial Network)
excerpt: A neural network with two competing networks: a generator and a discriminator.

title: Gemini
excerpt: Google's multimodal AI models that can process text, images, audio, and video.

title: Generative AI
excerpt: AI systems that create new content rather than just analyzing existing data.

title: GPU
excerpt: Graphics Processing Units that excel at parallel computations needed for AI training.

title: GPT
excerpt: OpenAI's Generative Pre-trained Transformer series powering ChatGPT.

title: Grok
excerpt: An AI assistant by xAI integrated with X (Twitter), known for real-time information access.

title: Gradient
excerpt: A vector indicating direction and magnitude of change needed to reduce model error.

title: Gradient Descent
excerpt: The optimization algorithm training neural networks by adjusting weights to reduce error.

title: Grounding
excerpt: Connecting AI outputs to verified sources to reduce hallucinations.

title: Guardrails
excerpt: Safety mechanisms constraining AI behavior to prevent harmful outputs.

title: Hallucination
excerpt: When AI generates plausible-sounding but incorrect or fabricated information.

title: Hidden Layer
excerpt: Layers between input and output in neural networks that learn complex representations.

title: HellaSwag
excerpt: A benchmark testing commonsense natural language inference and reasoning capabilities.

title: Human-in-the-Loop (HITL)
excerpt: A design approach where humans review AI outputs before they're acted upon.

title: Hugging Face
excerpt: A platform for sharing AI models, datasets, and the popular Transformers library.

title: HumanEval
excerpt: A benchmark evaluating code generation capabilities of LLMs with programming problems and tests.

title: Hyperparameter
excerpt: Configuration settings controlling training rather than learned from data.

title: Image Generation
excerpt: AI systems creating images from text descriptions using diffusion or GAN models.

title: In-Context Learning
excerpt: An LLM's ability to learn from examples in the prompt without weight updates.

title: Inference
excerpt: Running a trained model to generate predictions on new data.

title: Instruction Tuning
excerpt: Fine-tuning LLMs to better follow user instructions and requests.

title: Interpretability
excerpt: The degree to which humans can understand how a model makes decisions.

title: Jailbreak
excerpt: Attempts to bypass AI safety restrictions through crafted prompts.

title: JSON
excerpt: A structured data format commonly used for API responses and LLM structured output.

title: JSON Mode
excerpt: An API setting constraining model output to valid JSON format.

title: Knowledge Cutoff
excerpt: The date beyond which an AI model has no training data about events.

title: Knowledge Graph
excerpt: A structured representation of facts as interconnected entities and relationships.

title: KV Cache
excerpt: An optimization storing computed key-value vectors to speed up text generation.

title: Label
excerpt: The correct answer associated with training data in supervised learning.

title: Latency
excerpt: The time delay between sending a prompt and receiving a response.

title: Learning Rate
excerpt: A hyperparameter controlling how much weights are adjusted during training.

title: LangChain
excerpt: A popular framework for building applications with LLMs, providing abstractions for chains, agents, and memory.

title: LlamaIndex
excerpt: A data framework for connecting LLMs to external data sources, specializing in indexing and RAG.

title: Llama
excerpt: Meta's open-weight family of large language models enabling widespread use.

title: Large Language Model (LLM)
excerpt: An AI system trained on massive text data to understand and generate human language.

title: LoRA
excerpt: Low-Rank Adaptation - a parameter-efficient fine-tuning technique.

title: Loss Function
excerpt: A function measuring how wrong a model's predictions are during training.

title: LSTM
excerpt: Long Short-Term Memory - a recurrent architecture for capturing long-range dependencies.

title: Machine Learning (ML)
excerpt: A branch of AI where systems learn patterns from data rather than being explicitly programmed.

title: Midjourney
excerpt: A popular AI image generation service known for artistic, stylized outputs.

title: Mistral
excerpt: A French AI company known for efficient, high-performance open models.

title: MoE (Mixture of Experts)
excerpt: An architecture where different expert sub-networks specialize in different inputs.

title: MMLU
excerpt: Massive Multitask Language Understanding - a benchmark testing models on 57 subjects.

title: Model
excerpt: The trained AI system that processes inputs and generates outputs.

title: Model Collapse
excerpt: A degradation phenomenon where models trained on AI-generated data lose diversity and quality.

title: Model Card
excerpt: Documentation describing a model's use, limitations, and ethical considerations.

title: Multi-Head Attention
excerpt: Running multiple attention operations in parallel, each focusing on different aspects.

title: Multimodal
excerpt: AI systems processing and generating multiple content types (text, images, audio, video).

title: Named Entity Recognition (NER)
excerpt: An NLP task identifying and classifying named entities (people, places, organizations).

title: Natural Language
excerpt: Human language as we naturally speak and write it, which AI assistants understand.

title: Neural Network
excerpt: A computing system inspired by biological brains, the foundation of modern AI.

title: Next Token Prediction
excerpt: The core LLM training objective: predict the next token given previous tokens.

title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
excerpt: The AI field enabling computers to understand and generate human language.

title: Normalization
excerpt: Techniques to standardize inputs or layer outputs for stable training.

title: One-Shot Learning
excerpt: Providing a single example in a prompt to demonstrate desired output format.

title: Open Source / Open Weight
excerpt: AI models with publicly available weights that can be downloaded and run locally.

title: OpenAI
excerpt: The AI company behind GPT models, ChatGPT, and DALL-E.

title: Optimization
excerpt: The process of adjusting model parameters to minimize loss during training.

title: Output Layer
excerpt: The final layer of a neural network producing the model's predictions.

title: Overfitting
excerpt: When a model performs well on training data but poorly on new data.

title: Parameters
excerpt: The learned weights in AI models. LLMs have billions of parameters.

title: PEFT
excerpt: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning techniques training only a subset of parameters.

title: Perplexity
excerpt: A metric measuring how "surprised" a language model is by text.

title: Persona
excerpt: A specific character or role assigned to AI through prompting.

title: Positional Encoding
excerpt: A technique injecting position information into transformers.

title: PPO (Proximal Policy Optimization)
excerpt: A reinforcement learning algorithm commonly used in RLHF to train language models.

title: Precision
excerpt: In metrics: proportion of positive predictions that are correct. In computing: numerical format.

title: Pre-Training
excerpt: Initial training where models learn general language understanding from vast text.

title: Prompt
excerpt: The text input sent to an AI including context, instructions, and constraints.

title: Prompt Chaining
excerpt: Breaking complex tasks into sequential prompts building on each other.

title: Prompt Engineering
excerpt: The practice of crafting effective prompts using techniques and frameworks.

title: Prompt Injection
excerpt: A security vulnerability where malicious instructions cause unintended behavior.

title: Prompt Template
excerpt: A reusable prompt structure with placeholders for variable content.

title: QLoRA
excerpt: Quantized LoRA enabling fine-tuning on consumer GPUs.

title: Quantization
excerpt: Reducing weight precision to decrease memory usage and increase speed.

title: Query
excerpt: In RAG/search: the user's question. In attention: one of the QKV vectors.

title: Question Answering (QA)
excerpt: An NLP task where models answer questions based on context or knowledge.

title: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
excerpt: Combining AI generation with information retrieval for accurate, grounded responses.

title: Rate Limit
excerpt: Restrictions on API usage measured in requests or tokens per minute.

title: ReAct
excerpt: A framework combining Reasoning and Acting for transparent problem-solving.

title: Recall
excerpt: A metric measuring the proportion of actual positives correctly identified.

title: Red Team
excerpt: A group testing AI systems by attempting to find vulnerabilities and bypass safety.

title: Regression
excerpt: A machine learning task predicting continuous values rather than categories.

title: Regularization
excerpt: Techniques preventing overfitting by adding constraints during training.

title: Reinforcement Learning (RL)
excerpt: Learning where agents learn by receiving rewards or penalties for actions.

title: RLHF
excerpt: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback for aligning models with preferences.

title: RNN (Recurrent Neural Network)
excerpt: A neural network processing sequences by maintaining hidden state.

title: Role Prompting
excerpt: Assigning AI a specific persona or expertise to shape responses.

title: RoPE (Rotary Position Embedding)
excerpt: A positional encoding technique enabling better length generalization.

title: Sampling
excerpt: The process of selecting the next token during text generation.

title: Scaling Laws
excerpt: Empirical relationships showing how performance improves with scale.

title: Self-Attention
excerpt: Attention where a sequence attends to itself, the core transformer operation.

title: Self-Consistency
excerpt: Generating multiple reasoning paths and selecting the most common answer.

title: Semantic Kernel
excerpt: Microsoft's open-source SDK for building AI applications with LLMs and plugin architecture.

title: Semantic Search
excerpt: Search based on meaning rather than keyword matching using embeddings.

title: Sentiment Analysis
excerpt: Determining the emotional tone of text (positive, negative, neutral).

title: SFT (Supervised Fine-Tuning)
excerpt: Training models on labeled examples of desired behavior before RLHF.

title: Softmax
excerpt: A function converting raw scores into probabilities that sum to 1.

title: Stable Diffusion
excerpt: An open-source text-to-image model from Stability AI.

title: Streaming
excerpt: Receiving AI output incrementally as it's generated for better UX.

title: Summarization
excerpt: Condensing longer text into shorter summaries (extractive or abstractive).

title: Supervised Learning
excerpt: Learning from labeled examples where correct answers are provided.

title: Sycophancy
excerpt: When AI excessively agrees with users rather than providing accurate information.

title: Synthetic Data
excerpt: Artificially generated data used when real data is scarce or sensitive.

title: System Prompt
excerpt: Instructions given before conversation that shape all AI responses.

title: Temperature
excerpt: A parameter controlling randomness in outputs. Lower = focused, higher = creative.

title: Text Generation
excerpt: The AI task of producing human-like text from prompts.

title: Throughput
excerpt: The rate at which a system processes requests, measured in tokens per second.

title: Token
excerpt: The basic unit AI uses to process text, roughly 4 characters in English.

title: Tokenization
excerpt: Breaking text into tokens for model processing using algorithms like BPE.

title: Top-K Sampling
excerpt: A generation strategy limiting token selection to the K most probable options.

title: Top-P (Nucleus Sampling)
excerpt: Sampling from tokens until cumulative probability reaches P, adapting to context.

title: Training
excerpt: Teaching a model by exposing it to data and adjusting parameters to reduce error.

title: Training Data
excerpt: The content used to teach AI models, affecting capabilities and biases.

title: Transfer Learning
excerpt: Using knowledge from one task to improve performance on another.

title: Transformer
excerpt: The revolutionary architecture using self-attention that powers modern AI.

title: Tree-of-Thought
excerpt: A prompting technique exploring multiple reasoning paths simultaneously.

title: Underfitting
excerpt: When a model is too simple to capture patterns, performing poorly on all data.

title: Unsupervised Learning
excerpt: Learning from unlabeled data, discovering patterns without explicit guidance.

title: User Prompt
excerpt: The input provided by users in conversation, distinct from system prompts.

title: Validation
excerpt: Testing model performance on data not used in training.

title: Vector
excerpt: An ordered list of numbers representing data in mathematical space.

title: Vector Database
excerpt: A database optimized for storing and searching high-dimensional vectors.

title: Vision-Language Model (VLM)
excerpt: AI models processing both images and text for visual understanding.

title: Weight
excerpt: The numerical parameters learned during training that determine model behavior.

title: Whisper
excerpt: OpenAI's speech recognition model for high-accuracy audio transcription.

title: Word Embedding
excerpt: Dense vector representations of words where similar words have similar vectors.

title: XAI (Explainable AI)
excerpt: The field focused on making AI decisions understandable to humans.

title: XML Tags (in Prompting)
excerpt: Using XML-style tags to structure prompts and delineate sections clearly.

title: YOLO (You Only Look Once)
excerpt: A real-time object detection algorithm processing images in a single pass for fast detection.

title: Zero-Shot Learning
excerpt: Performing tasks without examples, relying on pre-trained knowledge.

title: Zero-Shot Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Adding "Let's think step by step" to trigger reasoning without examples.

title: Prompt Basics
excerpt: Learn the fundamental principles of effective AI prompting. Perfect for beginners starting their journey with AI communication.

title: What is a Prompt?
excerpt: A prompt is the text input you send to an AI. Learn how to structure your requests for better AI responses.

title: Anatomy of a Prompt
excerpt: Understand the key components that make up an effective prompt: context, task, format, and constraints.

title: CRISP Method
excerpt: Context, Role, Instructions, Specifics, Parameters. The essential framework for clear, effective prompts.

title: CRISP: Context
excerpt: Set the stage with background information. Help AI understand your situation and what you're trying to achieve.

title: CRISP: Role
excerpt: Define the persona for the AI to adopt. Assign expertise or perspective to shape responses appropriately.

title: CRISP: Instructions
excerpt: Provide specific guidelines for the task. Tell AI exactly what you want it to accomplish.

title: CRISP: Specifics
excerpt: Define format, length, tone, and scope. Add the details that shape how the output should look and sound.

title: CRISP: Parameters
excerpt: Set constraints and boundaries. Define what to include, exclude, or avoid in the response.

title: CRISPE Method
excerpt: CRISP plus Example for few-shot learning. Particularly useful for creative tasks where showing is better than telling.

title: CRISPE: Example
excerpt: Provide examples to show AI the format or style you want. Demonstrations help achieve consistent, patterned outputs.

title: COSTAR Method
excerpt: Context, Objective, Style, Tone, Audience, Response. Ideal for professional content creation with specific voice and audience requirements.

title: COSTAR: Objective
excerpt: Define the specific goal or outcome you want. Be clear about what success looks like.

title: COSTAR: Style
excerpt: Specify the writing style: formal, casual, technical, conversational. Match the content to its purpose.

title: COSTAR: Tone
excerpt: Set the emotional tone: professional, friendly, urgent, encouraging. Shape how the message feels.

title: COSTAR: Audience
excerpt: Identify who will receive the content. Tailor language and complexity to your audience.

title: COSTAR: Response
excerpt: Define the desired response format: list, paragraph, table, JSON. Specify exactly how output should be structured.

title: ReAct Method
excerpt: Reasoning + Acting. For complex tasks requiring transparent, verifiable thinking processes. AI shows its work.

title: ReAct: Reasoning
excerpt: The thinking phase where AI analyzes the problem, considers options, and plans its approach.

title: ReAct: Acting
excerpt: The action phase where AI executes based on its reasoning. Clear connection between thought and action.

title: Flipped Interaction Method
excerpt: Let AI interview you first. Prevent generic advice by having AI ask clarifying questions before responding.

title: Why Flipped Interaction Works
excerpt: AI can't give great advice without understanding your situation. Flipping the interaction ensures relevant, tailored responses.

title: How to Trigger Flipped Interaction
excerpt: Simple prompts like "Before answering, ask me 5 questions to understand my situation better" activate this pattern.

title: Chain-of-Thought Framework
excerpt: Encourage AI to think step-by-step through complex problems. Improves accuracy for math, logic, and analysis.

title: Few-Shot Learning Framework
excerpt: Provide 2-5 examples to help AI understand the pattern you want. More effective than description for complex formats.

title: Role Prompting Framework
excerpt: Assign AI a specific role or persona to shape its responses. Useful for expert knowledge and consistent tone.

title: Constrained Output Framework
excerpt: Define exact output formats, lengths, and structures. Essential for integrating AI outputs into workflows.

title: Self-Consistency Framework
excerpt: Ask AI to solve problems multiple ways and compare. Helps catch errors and improve accuracy.

title: Prompt Chaining Framework
excerpt: Break complex tasks into sequential prompts where each builds on previous outputs. Essential for complex workflows.

title: Prompt Analyzer
excerpt: Analyze your prompts against CRISP, COSTAR, and CRISPE frameworks. Get scores and suggestions for improvement.

title: Prompt Builder
excerpt: Build structured prompts step-by-step with guided questions. Choose your framework and get a ready-to-use prompt.

title: Method Matcher
excerpt: Describe your task and get a recommendation for which prompting method to use. Find the right framework for your needs.

title: Preflight Checklist
excerpt: Review your prompt before sending. Check for context, clarity, specificity, and potential issues.

title: Hallucination Spotter
excerpt: Practice identifying AI hallucinations. Learn to spot fake citations, invented facts, and fabricated information.

title: Persona Architect
excerpt: Design custom AI personas with sliders for expertise, tone, detail level, and creativity. Generate ready-to-use role prompts.

title: Temperature Visualizer
excerpt: Understand temperature and top-p settings through visual analogies. Learn when to use strict vs creative AI responses.

title: Bias Radar
excerpt: Scan prompts for biased or loaded language. Get suggestions for neutral rewrites and improve prompt fairness.

title: Specificity Slider
excerpt: Card-based game where you improve vague prompts by adding clarification cards. Build your specificity skills while having fun.

title: Jailbreak Defender
excerpt: Timed reaction game where you act as an AI safety filter. Quickly identify and block harmful prompts while accepting legitimate ones.

title: AI Readiness Quiz
excerpt: 40 questions across 4 levels: Good, Pro, Expert, Master. Test your AI prompting knowledge from basics to advanced.

title: Chain of Thought Pattern
excerpt: Encourage step-by-step reasoning by asking AI to "think through" problems before answering. Best for math, logic, debugging.

title: Few-Shot Learning Pattern
excerpt: Provide 2-5 examples of the input-output format you want before your actual request. Best for consistent formatting.

title: Role Prompting Pattern
excerpt: Assign AI a specific role or expertise to shape its responses and vocabulary. Best for technical writing and specialized content.

title: Structured Output Pattern
excerpt: Define the exact format you want (JSON, table, outline) before the request. Best for data extraction and consistent reports.

title: Self-Consistency Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to verify its own work or approach a problem multiple ways and compare. Best for math and fact-checking.

title: Prompt Chaining Pattern
excerpt: Break complex tasks into sequential prompts where each output feeds the next input. Best for long documents and research.

title: Devil's Advocate Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to argue against a position or find weaknesses in an idea. Best for decision making and risk assessment.

title: Constraints First Pattern
excerpt: State limitations and requirements before the main request to frame the response. Best for length control and audience targeting.

title: Flipped Interaction Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to interview you first before giving advice. Prevents generic responses. Best for personalized advice and strategic planning.

title: What is a prompt?
excerpt: A prompt is the text you send to an AI assistant. It can be a question, instruction, request, or any combination.

title: Which AI should I use?
excerpt: The techniques taught here work with any modern AI assistant. Each has different strengths, but prompting fundamentals are universal.

title: Do I need technical skills?
excerpt: No. AI assistants understand natural language. You don't need coding skills or technical knowledgejust clear communication.

title: Where should I start learning?
excerpt: Start with Prompt Basics to understand core concepts, then move to CRISP Method as your first framework.

title: Which prompting method should I use?
excerpt: CRISP for everyday tasks, CRISPE for creative work with examples, COSTAR for professional content, ReAct for complex problems.

title: Do I have to memorize these frameworks?
excerpt: No. Frameworks are learning tools. Once you internalize the concepts, you'll naturally include the right details without following a structure.

title: Can I combine different methods?
excerpt: Absolutely. The methods aren't rigid rulesthey're guidelines. Take elements from different frameworks based on what your task needs.

title: What's the difference between CRISP and CRISPE?
excerpt: CRISPE adds an "Example" component for few-shot learning. Useful for creative tasks where showing examples is more effective than describing.

title: What is a hallucination?
excerpt: When AI generates plausible but incorrect or made-up information. Includes fake citations, invented statistics, and fictional events.

title: Can I trust AI for medical, legal, or financial advice?
excerpt: No. AI should never replace professional advice in high-stakes domains. Use it to prepare questions, but critical decisions require qualified human professionals.

title: Is my data safe when using AI?
excerpt: Assume anything you type could be stored or used for training. Never share passwords, personal identifiers, or confidential business information.

title: Why does AI sometimes give wrong answers confidently?
excerpt: AI predicts likely text patternsit doesn't "know" things like humans. When it lacks information, it doesn't have uncertainty signals. Verification is essential.

title: Is Praxis really free?
excerpt: Yes, completely free. No account required, no premium tiers, no ads, no tracking. AI skills should be accessible to everyone.

title: Does this site use AI?
excerpt: Absolutely! The content and tools were developed with AI assistants. But interactive tools work locallynothing you type is transmitted anywhere.

title: Who created Praxis?
excerpt: Praxis was created by Basiliso Rosario with the mission of demystifying AI and making effective prompting skills accessible to everyone.

title: ChatGPT Guide
excerpt: Comprehensive guide to using ChatGPT effectively. Features, prompting techniques, and best practices for all skill levels.

title: Resources Hub
excerpt: Explore all Praxis resources: getting started guides, AI glossary, FAQ, and documentation about our mission and implementation.

title: About Praxis
excerpt: Learn about Praxis, its mission to make AI accessible to everyone, and the founder's vision for AI education.

title: AI Safety
excerpt: Understand AI limitations, risks, and best practices for responsible use. Essential knowledge for effective AI interaction.

title: Security Analysis
excerpt: Comprehensive security analysis and hardening practices. Learn about our A+ CSP rating and continuous security as a practice.

title: AI for Everybody
excerpt: Our mission to make AI literacy accessible to everyone regardless of background, ability, or experience level.

title: Universal Design (UD/UDL)
